commits.message:
Unlock related Gemfile dependencies, but not everything that changed (#8267)

Co-authored-by: Nish Sinha <nishnha@github.com>
Add subdirectory value while preparing pyproject.toml if subdirectory key exists (#8067)

Avoid incorrectly downgrading top level deps (#8279)

If we unlock other top level dependencies when trying to update a
dependency, that kind of auto-grouping is fine.

However, we should make sure we don't downgrade a top level dependency
just to upgrade another.

Bump sorbet-runtime from 0.5.11026 to 0.5.11094 in /updater (#8281)

Bumps [sorbet-runtime](https://github.com/sorbet/sorbet) from 0.5.11026 to 0.5.11094.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/sorbet/sorbet/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/sorbet/sorbet/commits)

---
updated-dependencies:
- dependency-name: sorbet-runtime
  dependency-type: direct:production
  update-type: version-update:semver-patch
...

Signed-off-by: dependabot[bot] <support@github.com>
Co-authored-by: dependabot[bot] <49699333+dependabot[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

Merge pull request #8276 from dependabot/bump-to-v0.236.0

v0.236.0

Relax detection of compilation errors

This is used to retry without build isolation, but the message has
changed in recent pip versions and was no longer matched. Now, at least
in some cases, the error reads like this:

```
pip._internal.exceptions.InstallationSubprocessError: Getting requirements to build wheel exited with 1
```
Pass message directly to error handling method

Move memoization out of fetch_ method

The convention is that those always perform some work.

Refactor error handle in pip-compile version resolver

Move the handling to wrap the only code that can raise those errors.

Copy extension compilation retry logic from updater checker into file updater

Otherwise, retries will never succeed since even if the checker manages
to find a target version to update to, the updater will fail to update
the files.

Merge pull request #8189 from dependabot/deivid-rodriguez/fix-multiple-pip-compile-errors

Fix multiple pip compile errors
Extract a method to reduce complexity

No need to loop through dependencies

We only try to update one at the moment.
Remove slow tag from spec no longer slow

Merge pull request #8190 from dependabot/deivid-rodriguez/poetry-multiple-req-replacement

Fix poetry multiple requirement replacement in pyproject.toml

Improve running updater tests (#8206)

This allows running updater specs like this:

```
$ script/ci-test-updater updater/spec/dependabot/service_spec.rb
```

It's slightly more verbose but you type less if you use tab-completion
of files.

build(deps): bump PNpm from 8.9.0 to 8.9.2 (#8202)

Release notes : 
https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/releases/tag/v8.9.2
https://github.com/pnpm/pnpm/releases/tag/v8.9.1

build(deps): bump yarn to 3.6.4 (#8151)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/yarnpkg/berry/compare/@yarnpkg/cli/3.6.3...@yarnpkg/cli/3.6.4

Merge pull request #8209 from dependabot/jamiemagee/linguist-generated-rbi

Mark `.rbi` as `linguist-generated`

Remove short SHAs as test examples

Short SHAs are no longer supported by GitHub Actions.

issue.title: Actions used from composite actions are not bumped by dependabot
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Package ecosystem

github actions

### Package manager version

_No response_

### Language version

_No response_

### Manifest location and content before the Dependabot update

_No response_

### dependabot.yml content

```yaml
version: 2
updates:
  - package-ecosystem: "github-actions"
    directory: "/"
    schedule:
      interval: "daily"
    open-pull-requests-limit: 1024

  - package-ecosystem: cargo
    directory: "/src/rust/"
    schedule:
      interval: daily
    allow:
      # Also update indirect dependencies
      - dependency-type: all
    open-pull-requests-limit: 1024

  - package-ecosystem: pip
    directory: "/"
    schedule:
      interval: daily
    open-pull-requests-limit: 1024
```

### Updated dependency

`actions/cache`

### What you expected to see, versus what you actually saw

I expect https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/blob/main/.github/actions/cache/action.yml#L33 to be upgraded by https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/pull/8365, but it's not.

### Native package manager behavior

_No response_

### Images of the diff or a link to the PR, issue, or logs

_No response_

### Smallest manifest that reproduces the issue

_No response_

comment.body: I believe it's correct that there's no standard directory for internal actions, however, nonetheless they could be discovered by recursively following local `uses:` from a workflow.

issue.title: Enable expanding granularity from major version to patch version
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Feature description

It's a common practice to declare the use of actions using just the major version, as in `- uses: actions/checkout@v3`. If I understand correctly, this means that it will use version 3 *exactly*, and will not use future patch or minor versions of the same action. This is good for reproducibility (basically, things should be locked in place and not move randomly outside of users' control), but really bad in terms of making sure the pipeline always uses the latest version. I can't seem to find any way to configure Dependabot to automatically update something like `actions/checkout@v3` to `actions/checkout@v3.0.1` when that version is available, without first _manually_ changing the entry to `actions/checkout@v3.0.0`.

comment.body: IMO the ideal solution would be the one used by `pre-commit autoupdate --freeze` - set the value to the commit ID of the latest tag, and add a _comment_ with the tag name.

issue.title: Enable expanding granularity from major version to patch version
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Feature description

It's a common practice to declare the use of actions using just the major version, as in `- uses: actions/checkout@v3`. If I understand correctly, this means that it will use version 3 *exactly*, and will not use future patch or minor versions of the same action. This is good for reproducibility (basically, things should be locked in place and not move randomly outside of users' control), but really bad in terms of making sure the pipeline always uses the latest version. I can't seem to find any way to configure Dependabot to automatically update something like `actions/checkout@v3` to `actions/checkout@v3.0.1` when that version is available, without first _manually_ changing the entry to `actions/checkout@v3.0.0`.

comment.body:
Yes, I don't love it either. You can also use branches though, see the [official recommendation](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/creating-actions/about-custom-actions#using-release-management-for-actions).

It'd be nice if actions management didn't require actions' author to keep a moving tag or branch so that major version references work. Ideally actions would do some sane resolution if a tag does not exist, like proposed here: https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/9847.

But it is what it is now!

issue.title: Enable expanding granularity from major version to patch version
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Feature description

It's a common practice to declare the use of actions using just the major version, as in `- uses: actions/checkout@v3`. If I understand correctly, this means that it will use version 3 *exactly*, and will not use future patch or minor versions of the same action. This is good for reproducibility (basically, things should be locked in place and not move randomly outside of users' control), but really bad in terms of making sure the pipeline always uses the latest version. I can't seem to find any way to configure Dependabot to automatically update something like `actions/checkout@v3` to `actions/checkout@v3.0.1` when that version is available, without first _manually_ changing the entry to `actions/checkout@v3.0.0`.

comment.body:
> By the way, yes v3 uses the v3 tag exactly. However, it's a convention for GitHub Actions that v3 will be a rolling tag that always points to the latest v3.x.y tag. So for most actions, it's actually the opposite: bad for reproducibility, but good for making sure you're using the latest version. I think that's pretty confusing but it's how it is now.

So people break the universal convention of tags being fixed in the name of convenience? :cry:

  dependency-group: dev-dependencies
...

payload.description: 🤖 Dependabot's core logic for creating update PR's.

release.name: v0.236.0
release.body:
## What's Changed
* check types in the updater too by @jakecoffman in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8238
* Type `ArtifactUpdater` and `VendorUpdater` by @JamieMagee in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8215
* fix markdown header formatting by @brettfo in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8194
* Ignore specs when running Sorbet by @JamieMagee in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8240
* add types to the ApiClient by @jakecoffman in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8239
* Removed unignore command feature flag by @honeyankit in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8241
* add types to service by @jakecoffman in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8246
* report extra information if a repo can't be found by @brettfo in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8191
* Correct handling of `updater` directory in sorbet by @JamieMagee in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8247
* Clarify docker logs about ignoring a normally expected update candidate by @deivid-rodriguez in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8262
* Add OpenTelemetry SDK by @JamieMagee in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8210
* Fix poetry regression by @deivid-rodriguez in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8263
* stop processing if updated_deps is empty by @brettfo in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8193
* add types to some of the Dependabot::Config classes by @jakecoffman in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8261
* Recurse submodules when cloning npm and yarn repos by @deivid-rodriguez in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/6718
* Unlock related Gemfile dependencies, but not everything that changed by @deivid-rodriguez in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8267
* Add subdirectory value while preparing pyproject.toml if subdirectory key exists by @VictoryKon in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8067
* Avoid incorrectly downgrading top level deps by @deivid-rodriguez in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8279
* Bump sorbet-runtime from 0.5.11026 to 0.5.11094 in /updater by @dependabot in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8281
* temporary fix for flaky test by @jakecoffman in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8284
* Sorbet types for `logger` and `commit_signer` by @JamieMagee in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8269
* Update autogenerated RBIs by @JamieMagee in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8271
* v0.236.0 by @dependabot-core-action-automation in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8276

## New Contributors
* @brettfo made their first contribution in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8194
* @VictoryKon made their first contribution in https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/pull/8067

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/compare/v0.235.0...v0.236.0

  • fix markdown header formatting by @brettfo in #8194
  • Ignore spe…

pull_request.title: Update autogenerated RBIs
pull_request.body:
These were autogenerated by `bundle exec tapioca gem`. Ideally this should be updated in lockstep with each dependency update, but we're not far enough along in our Sorbet adoption that new types affect us that much.

Maybe a GitHub action to update them on a monthly cadence would be enough for now.

issue.title: Support for Docker compose files
issue.body:
_From @armin-joellenbeck on December 23, 2017 9:21_

Knowing when new Docker images are published would be helpful when the are used in a Docker compose file too.

Just like #20, with the file `docker-compose.yml` instead of `Dockerfile`.

_Copied from original issue: dependabot/feedback#66_

comment.body: I made this a few months ago as a workaround until is supported by dependabot. https://github.com/sbe-arg/simple-compose-service-updates in case anyone is interested
